reviews.text: Even though check-in was little slow, the service was excellent. They even let us check-in an hour early. The stay was excellent, very friendly staff everywhere. We went with a 2 yr old, and they gave us a Johnson&Johnson travel pack (shampoo, shower gel, lotion, diaper rash cream, more lotion, baby powder) with a request of a crib. We also had a VIP Lounge access (a book online special) on the 5th floor, they fed us good up there for free, including breakfast, afternoon snack, and dinner. We also went to the fitness center and spa. No cost to us even without a massage. Spa room was great relaxing place to spend few hours. Final words, if you're looking for a little weekend get away, it's a great great place to go for $139!

reviews.title: Loved our stay here
reviews.text: This was our second stay here, we returned to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. Hotel staff were attentive at all times. Room was clean and was cleaned and tidied every day (even in evening when we were out!) Pools were clean and very quiet. Pool service excellent and coctkails reasonably priced and very good. Views from hotel outstanding. Brilliant location for early morning walks before the heat of the day. We stayed in Regency Suite room and the breakfast was excellent. We will definately return for 3rd visit from England.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "bumps" started upon turning into the hotel driveway. Heavy construction going on and the golf courses quite obviously closed (Oh no, that's why I booked here). Reaching the hotel I confirmed with the bellmen yes both courses which surround the hotel are closed in preparation for a tournament in November . . . for the first time this day (and not the last) I'm told "it'll be so great when they're done" . . . no one seems to realize that I'm staying here NOW not in November. Apparently, had I checked the website in August I would have learned they decided to close not one but both courses due to serious delays in construction of tournament facillities. Note to self, always double check a few weeks out. Of course, what should have happened was for them to notify me of the closures. After all, I provided both e-mail and phone contact information. They used both to try to sell me spa services prior to arrival, so why not notify my of significant changes to the facillity?
reviews.title: Disappointing, nothing Grand about this Hyatt

reviews.text: We love Palm Desert weekend getaways from LA and have stayed at various locations. We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt and made full use of the property/grounds. We checked in on Sat. morning. My husband played golf and said the course was beautiful. I went with a friend to the spa and we had great massages, hung out in the jacuzzis, and made use of the outdoor showers. The hotel also lets all guests take advantage of the steam room/jacuzzis/locker rooms without paying a day admission fee. The rooms were very nice, comfortable bed, clean and modern. The bathrooms with separate shower and open bath tub were very spacious. The hotel gave us adjoining rooms so we were able to hang out with our friends. Only desire- wished there was a DVD player in the room. We had breakfast at the restaurant just off the lobby, outdoors, overlooking the golf course. It was a great relaxing meal and was not outrageously priced. My friend complained that the Starbucks charges $3 for drip coffee (same as a latte) which didn't make sense. We loved hanging out around the pool. The resort was hosting a convention and apparently the property was full, however, it felt like nobody was there. On top of everything, our rooms were free as we used Hyatt points to stay. A great value for use of points. Overall, a great visit. I'd love to go back and possibly stay at the villas.
reviews.title: Great Resort Weekend Getaway from LA-Great Service and Grounds
Had a Pleasant Stay
reviews.text: My review is not a comprehensive one because we spent almost all of our time in our villa and had the butler (the butler is shared amongst a set of villas) take care of most of our needs, so we didn't explore the grounds much at all, so this review is for the villa alone. The villa was in great shape and the private back yard and spa was perfect for us. Our villa's back yard had a tall wall completely surrounding, so we had a great deal of privacy. The butler service was very good and the food was good, but not great. My wife, my daughter, and I had a very pleasant stay at our villa.

reviews.title: Thumbs down on the Kids "Camp Hyatt"
reviews.text: The reason we chose this hotel was because the kid's camp description on the Hyatt's website sounded great : "An incredible array of supervised activities awaits your children at our Palm Springs family resort, as they discover the wonders of nature surrounding us. They will learn about flora (plant life), fauna (animals), culture (history) and geography (the land where you are) of the region. Children will have a fun time zipping down our water slide, planting a cactus, designing sand paintings or enjoying a dive-in movie, just to name a few of the fabulous activities open to our campers." WOW, we thought..They'll have fun, play outside AND it will be educational!! NO DEAL..It was a sunny day, and FOUR out of the SEVEN hours of the camp was spent watching 2 movies. What a rip off at $75 per shot!!!!!!! "Learn about flora and fauna" they had a spiky lizard in a terrarium with a small cactus..THERE'S your flora and fauna lesson!!! Culture??! Nope. Designing sand paintings??! Nope. NO planting of cactus--I WISH they could of at least gone outside to see them!! Array of activities--hmm..LET'S SEE: 1) Watch TWO movies (does that count as 2 activities?); 2) make some plastic bead design that the girls iron and the kids take home; 3)Take 5 minutes to feed the fish in the Poi pond; 4) The girls decided to take the kids to the UNHEATED pool (they decided to turn the heater off just before the kids got there-apparently no one checked first) for about 20 minutes, so that's your array of activities..RIP OFF!!!!!!!!!!!

We just returned from our second annual stay (2 nights over Christmas) and again had a terrific time. Before I describe our stay, I will begin with a brief observation about these types of online reviews - they are skewed towards the few people who, legitimately or not, had bad experiences and thus are highly motivated to vent their frustrations (and those, like me, who then feel compelled to provide some degree of balance.) If you book wisely (translate: spend a little more for a better room) and visit when the resort is not jam packed with conventioneers, you will have a great time at this resort - esp. if you have kids.
